Name: Stela of Khememi and Ameni
Description: In the lunette of this tall rectangular stela are two jackals reclining on shrines. Beneath them is the offering formula in two rows of text. In the upper register are two men sitting in front of a richly laden offering table. Then there is a further row of hieroglyphs and a register showing four kneeling figures. The woman at the right-hand side is facing the three other figures, one man and two women. Each of the men is holding a napkin in his hand at chest height. Both texts and scenes still show traces of white paint. The stela is slightly damaged at the edges.
